head: Divorce Notice.
ab: Robert Little, vs Anna P. Little.
p: In the District Court for the 2d Judicial Dis't, holding terms at Olympia W. T.

To Ann P. Little:—You are hereby notified that Robert Little has filed a complaint against you in the in the said Court, which will come on to be heard at Chambers, in Olympia, before the Hon. C. C. Hewitt, Chief Justice of W. T., and Judge of the 2d Judicial District, on Wednesday, the 20th day of December, at 2 o'clock P.M., which is more than two-months after the date of this publication; and unless you appear at the said time and answer the same will be taken as confessed adn the prayer thereof granted.

The object and prayer of said petition is to obtain a divorce upon the ground of abandonment and for harsh and cruel treatment, incompaibility of temper and disposition, making it impossible for the parties to live together as husband and wife.
O. B. McFADDEN. Attorney for Plaintiff.
Date of publication, Oct. 7, 1865, Complaint filed Oct. 6th, 1865.
